news.title: Rakesh Roshan, wife buy five commercial units worth ₹19.68 crore in Mumbai
news.para: Filmmaker Rakesh Roshan and his wife Pramila have acquired five commercial units in Mumbai's Vaidya West World One Aeropolis. The total transaction amounted to ₹19.68 crore. These deals were registered in November 2025.

news.title: County Group acquires five-acres land in sector 151 Noida for ₹473 crore
news.para: County Group has secured a five-acre plot in Noida's Sector 151 for approximately ₹473 crore. The land was purchased through a state government auction. The company intends to build a premium, low-density residential development. This project will feature 226 homes spread across three apartment configurations. The total built-up area will span 11 lakh square feet.

news.title: Chandigarh to pilot land stack project in sector 9, Khudda Jassu
news.para: Chandigarh and Tamil Nadu have been selected by the Government of India for trials of its national Land Stack Project, aiming to create a unified digital platform for land and property records. Chandigarh will pilot the project in Sector 9 and Khudda Jassu village, showcasing integrated data for enhanced transparency and efficiency in land management.

news.title: Bengaluru’s homebuyers petition NHRC over delay in apartment ownership law
news.para: Thousands of homebuyers in Karnataka are facing rights violations due to the state's prolonged delay in notifying a new apartment ownership law. The Karnataka Home Buyers Forum has petitioned the National Human Rights Commission. This inaction prevents buyers from registering associations and securing ownership rights.

news.title: Delhi plans major circle rate overhaul to align property valuation with market prices
news.para: Delhi is set to overhaul its circle rates for the first time in over a decade, aiming to align property valuations with market realities. Key proposals include a new A+ category for ultra-premium areas like Lutyens' Delhi and a complete re-evaluation of farmhouse pricing based on location and market value.

news.title: PIL claims against Bhutani project in Sancoale are unfounded: Bombay HC
news.para: Bombay High Court has dismissed petitions challenging permissions for Bhutani's Acqua Eden project in Sancoale, deeming technical objections unfounded. Justices found no discrepancies in slope computations or hill-cutting permissions. The court accepted an undertaking that actual work won't start without environmental clearance, despite delays in securing it due to weather.

news.title: Varanasi: FIR against hotel for housing foreigners sans permission
news.para: Varanasi police have filed an FIR against the operator and manager of Hotel Dayal Tower for illegally accommodating foreign guests. The hotel failed to obtain mandatory permissions and registration, and did not report guest details to the FRRO as required by law. Investigations are ongoing into the alleged violation of the Foreigners Act.

news.title: Karnataka moves to let registrars scrap fake registrations
news.para: Karnataka has introduced draft rules empowering district registrars to cancel registrations made with forged documents, eliminating the need for court intervention. Sub-registrars can now refuse registration of fake documents, significantly strengthening property buyer protection against fraud. These rules aim to curb illegalities and safeguard citizens' properties.

news.title: Landlords to face legal action if tenants are involved in crime: Lucknow police
news.para: Lucknow Police have launched 'Operation Pehchaan', a tenant verification drive, mandating landlords to register tenant details online to prevent criminals from hiding in rented properties. Failure to comply will result in legal action against landlords if tenants are found involved in criminal activity. The initiative aims to enhance surveillance amid rising migration to the state capital.

news.title: Mumbai’s redevelopment wave pushes home rents to dizzying heights
news.para: Mumbai's rental market is experiencing a surge in prices and a shrinking supply, contrary to expectations. Redevelopment projects are forcing residents to pay higher market rents, creating a significant financial burden. This trend, driven by increased demand and limited availability, is expected to persist for several years, impacting both tenants and landlords.

news.title: Chandigarh: Consumer panel orders builder to refund over ₹12 lakh to plot buyers
news.para: A consumer commission has ordered a New Chandigarh real estate developer to refund Rs 12.63 lakh to two homebuyers. The developer must also pay 9% annual interest and Rs 50,000 for mental agony and litigation costs. Buyers booked a plot in 2015 and paid 30% of the sale price.

news.title: MahaRERA issues SOP to fast-track compensation recovery, sets 60-day timeline
news.para: MahaRERA has introduced a new SOP to expedite compensation recovery from non-compliant developers, adhering to Bombay High Court directives. The procedure mandates compensation within 60 days, with strict timelines for escalation, including property attachment and potential civil imprisonment for wilful evasion.

news.title: Centre notifies amendments to DDA's transit-oriented development policy
news.para: The central government has revised the Transit Oriented Development policy set by the Delhi Development Authority, which now encompasses areas within 500 meters of Metro and RRTS corridors. As part of this process, the DDA invites the community to voice their objections and suggestions. This shift aims to catalyze growth around essential mass transit stations.

news.title: Luxury hotels in Ahmedabad to pay wastewater tax
news.para: Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation will implement a new wastewater user charge on over 20 luxury hotels, starting in the 2026-27 financial year. This move, mandated by a World Bank loan, will see hotels generating over 10 KL of wastewater daily charged Rs 8 per KL. The revenue will support the AMC's ongoing sewage treatment and drainage system upgrades.

news.title: Pune: PMRDA cracks down on illegal plotting in Purandar
news.para: Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority is taking strong action against illegal plotting in Purandar taluka. Unauthorised layouts in three villages have been demolished. This drive follows complaints from buyers who purchased plots without necessary permissions. The action is focused on areas near the proposed Purandar airport. Land acquisition for the airport is progressing with high landowner consent.

news.title: Bhubaneswar: BMC orders demolition of unauthorised construction in Sampur apartment complex
news.para: Authorities in Bhubaneswar have ordered the demolition of unauthorized construction at a multi-storied apartment complex following complaints from homebuyers. The developer violated crucial building norms, including setbacks and road width, and lacked an occupancy certificate. The court rejected pleas for regularization, citing non-compoundable deviations and emphasizing strict action against illegal constructions.

news.title: Odisha approves policy to become hub for GCCs
news.para: Odisha government has greenlit a policy that provides attractive incentives for multinational firms aiming to establish Global Capability Centres footprint in the region. This initiative promises to invigorate the local economy by creating numerous job opportunities.

news.title: Delhi government to repair 2,416 flats for allocation among poor
news.para: Delhi government has approved the repair of 2,416 ready flats in Sawda Ghevra. Renovation work across Sultanpuri, Dwarka, and Bhalswa is also cleared. This is part of a larger plan to fix 50,000 unused EWS flats. The government aims to provide these homes to the poor. Essential facilities will be added to DUSIB colonies.
